text: Think of str like Julia's SubString. Because it's a SubString, it's always borrowed, so there is no str, only &str. Likewise, there is little point to &String when you may as well use &str

elements.text: Think of str like Julia's SubString. Because it's a SubString, it's always borrowed, so there is no str, only &str. Likewise, there is little point to &String when you may as well use &str

text: The extra confusing bit is that string literals are `&'static str` since they are a borrowed reference to data in the program's code itself

since they are a borrowed reference to data in the program's code itself
